result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyenta L. Mathis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 04-07-16 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Any sentence; Huber privileges for work and childcare. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyenta L. Mathis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keyenta L. Mathis in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  The defendant wishes to revoke the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Based upon the defendant's defendant's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 25 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; Huber privileges for work and childcare. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 4/7/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
Per request of defense counsel, case is adjourned from 8/17/2015 to 7/7/2015.  lms
As of August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33,  Court will be down on 8/10/2015, case is adjourned to 8/17/2015 at 10:00am.  Parties notified.  lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report, received and filed. lms
Received and Filed, E-mail with an update from Justice Point.
Received and Filed, Justice Point DPA Report.

Defendant Keyenta L. Mathis in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant attended all contacts and completed community service. State needs to see all negative tests at the Final Review. 

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Joseph Donald, Branch 2.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

**Defendant to report to JusticePoint by 12:00pm on 2/11/2015.

Defendant Keyenta L. Mathis in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 2/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
